column4: Anyone knows if installing Windows will mess up with grub (and probably mess with Ubuntu)?
Will it get picked up too?
Did you have a look at the link that I gave you, a while ago? http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/index
It should answer just about any questions that you may have..
The funny thing about Brassero is it gives screwy error messages but burns the CD fine, with no problems; go figure.
That's the beauty of FOSS; there's a ton of burning software, at your finger tips, try as many as you want and stick with what works best for you.
I would assume that "normal" FF is windows based and the latter linux based; different directory structure, different plug-ins, etc..
By 'windows based' do you mean MS Windows OS?
I'm assuming that's what you meant by 'normal.'
If the other one is for Linux, then why is it Ubuntu only. Shouldn't it be like Firefox for Linux rather than Firefox for Ubuntu
I think it is mostly like something with Ubuntu
Perhaps have a look here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefox  It states that it's linux compatible as well as other OSs.. Most certainly not an exclusive ubuntu browser regarding it's *nix varient.
I know that. I think you didn't understand the problem (or I failed to explain it.)
Perhaps you're correct; it's early, here and I need my second cup-o-coffee. Please feel free to restate your question.. BRB.
